intro: Astragalus psilacmos, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus psilacmos plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native habitat.
